channel.title: CVE Feed for Qualcomm, Inc. -- All Qualcomm products
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Qualcomm, Inc. -- All Qualcomm products

item.title: CVE-2017-8254|2024-08-05T16:27:22.996Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, an audio client pointer is dereferenced before being checked if it is valid.

item.title: CVE-2017-8237|2024-08-05T16:27:23.250Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a buffer overflow vulnerability exists while loading a firmware image.

item.title: CVE-2017-8256|2024-08-05T16:27:23.433Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, array out of bounds access can occur if userspace sends more than 16 multicast addresses.

item.title: CVE-2017-8267|2024-08-05T16:27:23.326Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a race condition exists in an IOCTL handler potentially leading to an integer overflow and then an out-of-bounds write.

item.title: CVE-2017-7368|2024-08-05T15:56:36.457Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a race condition potentially exists in the ioctl handler of a sound driver.

item.title: CVE-2017-7370|2024-08-05T15:56:36.417Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a race condition exists in a video driver potentially leading to a use-after-free condition.

item.title: CVE-2017-8263|2024-08-05T16:27:23.228Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a kernel fault can occur when doing certain operations on a read-only virtual address in userspace.

item.title: CVE-2017-9678|2024-08-05T17:18:01.415Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, in a video driver, memory corruption can potentially occur due to lack of bounds checking in a memcpy().

item.title: CVE-2017-6421|2024-08-05T15:25:49.295Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In the touch controller function in all Qualcomm products with Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, or QRD Android, a variable may be controlled by the user and can lead to a buffer overflow.

item.title: CVE-2017-7371|2024-08-05T15:56:36.483Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a data pointer is potentially used after it has been freed when SLIMbus is turned off by Bluetooth.

item.title: CVE-2017-8253|2024-08-05T16:27:23.247Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, kernel memory can potentially be overwritten if an invalid master is sent from userspace.

item.title: CVE-2017-7364|2024-08-05T15:56:36.455Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, in function __mdss_fb_copy_destscaler_data(), variable ds_data[i].scale may still point to a user-provided address (which could point to arbitrary kernel address), so on an error condition, this user-provided address will be freed (arbitrary free), and continued operation could result in use after free condition.

item.title: CVE-2017-8241|2024-08-05T16:27:22.998Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a buffer overflow vulnerability exists in a WLAN function due to an incorrect message length.

item.title: CVE-2017-8233|2024-08-05T16:27:23.146Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In a camera driver function in all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a bounds check is missing when writing into an array potentially leading to an out-of-bounds heap write.

item.title: CVE-2017-8269|2024-08-05T16:27:23.365Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: Userspace-controlled non null terminated parameter for IPA WAN ioctl in all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel can lead to exposure of kernel memory.

item.title: CVE-2017-7373|2024-08-05T15:56:36.466Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a double free vulnerability exists in a display driver.

item.title: CVE-2017-8262|2024-08-05T16:27:23.256Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, in some memory allocation and free functions, a race condition can potentially occur leading to a Use After Free condition.

item.title: CVE-2017-9682|2024-08-05T17:18:01.183Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a race condition in two KGSL driver functions can lead to a Use After Free condition.

item.title: CVE-2017-8238|2024-08-05T16:27:23.427Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a buffer overflow vulnerability exists in a camera function.

item.title: CVE-2017-9685|2024-08-05T17:18:00.331Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a race condition in a WLAN driver can lead to a Use After Free condition.

item.title: CVE-2017-8242|2024-08-05T16:27:22.989Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a race condition exists in a QTEE driver potentially leading to an arbitrary memory write.

item.title: CVE-2017-8260|2024-08-05T16:27:23.254Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, due to a type downcast, a value may improperly pass validation and cause an out of bounds write later.

item.title: CVE-2017-8239|2024-08-05T16:27:23.015Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, userspace-controlled parameters for flash initialization are not sanitized potentially leading to exposure of kernel memory.

item.title: CVE-2017-8259|2024-08-05T16:27:23.067Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In the service locator in all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a buffer overflow can occur as the variable set for determining the size of the buffer is not used to indicate the size of the buffer.

item.title: CVE-2017-7372|2024-08-05T15:56:36.471Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a race condition exists in a video driver potentially leading to buffer overflow or write to arbitrary pointer location.

item.title: CVE-2017-9679|2024-08-05T17:18:01.395Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, if a userspace string is not NULL-terminated, kernel memory contents can leak to system logs.

item.title: CVE-2017-8273|2024-08-05T16:34:21.662Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android release from CAF using the Linux kernel, while processing fastboot boot command when verified boot feature is disabled, with length greater than boot image buffer, a buffer overflow can occur.

item.title: CVE-2017-9684|2024-08-05T17:18:01.011Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a race condition in a USB driver can lead to a Use After Free condition.

item.title: CVE-2017-8270|2024-08-05T16:27:23.241Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a race condition exists in a driver potentially leading to a use-after-free condition.

item.title: CVE-2017-8268|2024-08-05T16:27:23.250Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, the camera application can possibly request frame/command buffer processing with invalid values leading to the driver performing a heap buffer over-read.

item.title: CVE-2017-8255|2024-08-05T16:27:22.916Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, an integer overflow vulnerability exists in boot.

item.title: CVE-2017-8235|2024-08-05T16:27:22.912Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a memory structure in a camera driver is not properly protected.

item.title: CVE-2017-8272|2024-08-05T16:34:21.564Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, in a driver function, a value from userspace is not properly validated potentially leading to an out of bounds heap write.

item.title: CVE-2017-8243|2024-08-05T16:27:22.985Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: A buffer overflow can occur in all Qualcomm products with Android for MSM, Firefox OS for MSM, or QRD Android when processing a firmware image file.

item.title: CVE-2017-8236|2024-08-05T16:27:23.007Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a buffer overflow vulnerability exists in an IPA driver.

item.title: CVE-2017-9680|2024-08-05T17:18:01.102Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, if a pointer argument coming from userspace is invalid, a driver may use an uninitialized structure to log an error message.

item.title: CVE-2017-8258|2024-08-05T16:27:23.084Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: An array out-of-bounds access in all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel can potentially occur in a camera driver.

item.title: CVE-2017-7365|2024-08-05T15:56:36.526Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a buffer overread can occur if a particular string is not NULL terminated.

item.title: CVE-2017-8266|2024-08-05T16:27:23.015Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a race condition exists in a video driver potentially leading to a use-after-free condition.

item.title: CVE-2017-8265|2024-08-05T16:27:23.238Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a race condition exists in a video driver which can lead to a double free.

item.title: CVE-2017-8234|2024-08-05T16:27:22.914Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, an out of bounds access can potentially occur in a camera function.

item.title: CVE-2017-8261|2024-08-05T16:27:22.909Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, in a camera driver ioctl, a kernel overwrite can potentially occur.

item.title: CVE-2017-8264|2024-08-05T16:27:23.325Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: A userspace process can cause a Denial of Service in the camera driver in all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel.

item.title: CVE-2017-7369|2024-08-05T15:56:36.504Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, an array index in an ALSA routine is not properly validating potentially leading to kernel stack corruption.

item.title: CVE-2017-8240|2024-08-05T16:27:22.969Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a kernel driver has an off-by-one buffer over-read vulnerability.

item.title: CVE-2017-8257|2024-08-05T16:27:23.253Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, when accessing the sde_rotator debug interface for register reading with multiple processes, one process can free the debug buffer while another process still has the debug buffer in use.

item.title: CVE-2017-8271|2024-08-05T16:27:23.326Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: Out of bound memory write can happen in the MDSS Rotator driver in all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel by an unsanitized userspace-controlled parameter.

item.title: CVE-2017-7367|2024-08-05T15:56:36.455Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- all%20qualcomm%20products
item.description: In all Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, an integer underflow vulnerability exists while processing the boot image.
